title: UMD announces James Clapper as winter commencement speaker
author: Eric Neugeboren

image.alt: Retired Air Force Lt. Gen. James Clapper, former director of National Intelligence, spoke to the Corp of Cadets, speaks in New London, Connecticut, March 23, 2016.

blurb:
Former Director of National Intelligence James Clapper will speak at the University of Marylandâ€™s winter commencement, the school announced Tuesday.

Clapper, who graduated from this university in 1963, served as the director of national intelligence under former President Barack Obama from 2010 to 2017. He did intelligence work for the military during his 32 years of service and served as an adviser to Congress and the defense and energy departments with regards to intelligence matters.
